name: Research Station 3152
body:
You are an AI in control of an abandoned Research Station. Defend it at all costs.

HOW TO PLAY

Use the mouse to move around the view and grab the drones / fuel blobs.
Offline drones (hover and it will tell you) require fuel to start. Fuel and more drones periodically spawn.
Some pirates will appear, you must defend your station by holding the drones in place and moving them around. 
Some of them take their time to arrive, space is big!

KEYS

Left mouse button - Grab objects (hold down the button)

Esc - open pause menu

![2019-10-08_01-53-32 Game.png](ludum-dare/45/research-station-3152/images/2852a.png)

comments.body: Cool but there appears to be only one wave.

name: Pay With Your Blood
body:
# Pay With Your Blood

## Gameplay
Mission: Kill all enemies.
Buy weapons from shop. Pay with your blood!

## Keys
| Key(s)              | Action           |
| --------------------|:----------------:|
| Arrows / WASD       | Move             | 
| Spacebar / LMB      | Shoot            |
| Mouse               | Aim              |
| Numbers / Scroll    | Switch weapon    |
| Esc                 | Open pause menu  |


![2019-04-28_23-42-20 Unity WebGL Player _ Pay With Your Blood.png](ludum-dare/44/pay-with-your-blood/images/2119e.png)

![2019-04-28_23-42-32 Unity WebGL Player _ Pay With Your Blood.png](ludum-dare/44/pay-with-your-blood/images/2119f.png)

comments.body: Great retro action game! Nice difficulty, didn't finish all the levels on first try but I didn't get frustrated either. I like the tile graphics, nice and clean. The shadow is a nice touch as well. At first it felt really bad that up is up with mouse aiming. I would have prefered strafing and going forward. After a while I did learn to play with the controls, so it's not a big deal I guess. I feel like the best start on the first level was just spam the bat. I couldn't figure out how to dodge and time my hits. Maybe it's just me. I played this on macbook with touchpad. It runs well, but I couldn't switch my weapons. I seemed to do fine with just one weapon / level anyway. All in all, great game. Great music and sfx! :D
Really fun!

I really like the shooting mechanics as well as the different weapons as having multiple weapons really adds depth to the game! I think maybe the shotgun should maybe have done less damage over range, but that's not an issue whatsoever! Overall, this is a really good jam entry!

Wow, very nice Hotline Miami homage, top-down action and a cool tune as well :-)

Of course the enemy movement could have been a little more sophisticated ;-)

It is a nice little game, the graphics are fine for a Ludum Dare game. Funny programmer art. The music is very cool.

Music is amazing, gameplay and sfx as well. Really well done. Only thing I would recommend is to make the player just a little bit bigger in relation to the level. Usually I don't really like top down shooters but this was actually fun! Well done!

Cool game! I like how every level is a bit of a puzzle - which weapon to buy and how much ammo.
The club feels a bit off in the beginning but the guns are pretty snappy and explosives are always fun.

Some more ways to lure enemies into traps / distract them would be an interesting addition.

The music was also pretty nice - I was sad when the shop music was stopped when starting a level :stuck_out_tongue:
Really nice. Fun little top down game. I feel like the graphics are a bit inconsistent but I’m always picky with graphics :P

Solid music and sounds. I like the way that you integrated the theme into the gameplay in a really thoughtful manner. If you continue work on this I'd love to see more enemy behaviors! Could really spice things up!
Nice game. The music was good. Good job!

I like the music and art, they fit together well. The movement was smooth and I liked the mouse aiming. The enemy AI was pretty good and I definitely approve of having multiple types of enemies in a level. The sound effects were also on point.

Unfortunately there was a pretty big bug for me on both Firefox and Chrome - I couldn't switch weapons at all and would get stuck with an empty gun and killed. I'd say the basic club weapon should maybe have some changes so I can win fights by skill instead of just trading damage for damage. 

Also there was this pretty funny bug here - the enemies can push you outside of the level:

![chrome_2019-05-05_00-06-39.png](ludum-dare/44/pay-with-your-blood/images/249ec.png)
I like the music. The gameplay is ok, but the enemy's AI often gets stuck. The C4 sometimes glitches and flies through the room stopping at the first wall. Overall I think it's nice but glitchy.

Fits the theme as proper and makes for a decent, yet sometimes a buggy top down shooter which i like for the fact that gives options of what i can use each level!

Great job!
the character is too slow which makes the fight slow and rigid.

name: Not Safe for Teamwork
body:
# Not Safe for Teamwork

## Gameplay
Control multiple characters, complete puzzles, reach level end. Sacrifice some characters.

## Keys
| Key(s)              | Action           |
| --------------------|:----------------:|
| Arrows              | Move             | 
| Spacebar            | Interact         |
| 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 / Tab | Switch character |
| Esc / P             | Open pause menu  |
No mouse controls.

## Story

*Corporate has sent you and your coworkers to a team-building exercise. You must complete tricky puzzles together, using your individual strengths and weaknesses to overcome challenges. Sometimes, in order to go forward, you have to leave your colleagues behind...*

![first.png](ludum-dare/43/not-safe-for-teamwork/images/1c26f.png)

comments.body: Enjoyable little puzzler! Fits the theme well, and I didn't encounter any bugs! A really nice level of challenge as it took a few goes to pass most levels. Well done!
very well done puzzles, and the sacrifice is cool!
Simple designed puzzle game, nice.

Nice puzzle game, it reminds of Chip's challenge and the likes just with more characters. Puzzles are well designed and visual + audio style goes well together with the gameplay. Sometimes I wish I had an overview over the map so it's not trial and error. Overall, I liked it :)
Really solid game you've got here. Could use a minimap or a better camera, but had a fun time with it!
Really felt like I was sacrificing team mates...  I was always hesitant to flip the switch! Great work, very complete and satisfying effort.

Wow, this was a surprisingly well put-together puzzle game. The last level really had me stumped for a while (I almost thought maybe you'd accidentally made the game unbeatable for a good 5 minutes or so)! That music just goes so well with the theme of the game, and the theme of the game goes so well with the theme of the jam.

I'm playing this because you submitted it to be a part of my Play & Improve series, but I'm honestly having difficulty thinking of what I'd even do. The only usability problem that bugged me was that I had to press 'P' before 'R' to restart! Other than that, it's really the graphics that need the most improvement and I'm a terrible artist. I don't think you need a minimap or a better camera - there was only one place where I couldn't see what I needed (bottom of the last level). I'm not great at designing puzzles and you've already got some great levels in here. I'm stumped! Is there anything you wish you could have done that I could take a stab at? If not, I'll think more on it...
Its like SAW (the movie) somehow ... sacrificing mates to continue to the other chambers of the game ... nice puzzles in this
Neat game! I included it in my compilation video series of games from the Ludum Dare, if you’d like to take a look :) https://youtu.be/8gcHVPkzZQo

Fun game, reminds me a lot of portal's co op. Music fits this really well, it feels like some sort of elevator music, very calm anyway. Level design is cool too, but sometimes i'd like to see all the characters at the same time, because sometimes the levels are so large, that when switching characters, i don't know where i am anymore. Great work!
Challenging level design, great puzzles.

Cool puzzle game, maybe add a view where you can see the entire level? Some of the larger levels it became quite hard to orientate yourself when switching characters. Also the movement was a little wonky and I think it could be improved to be more precise. Overall decent puzzles, some that were actually quite a challenge. Cool concept. Well done!

Hi there,

These are great puzzles!
Thank you for this nice game!

one remark:
* puzzle 2 & 3 are actually the same solution so it was not that engaging. I'm happy I tried the levels after that anyway because they were again fun to solve!
If you enjoy puzzles like this definitely try our game as well!
Interesting! Always a fan of a nice puzzle game. The concept was a bit brutal for my tastes, but the puzzles were nice in a Chip's Challenge -esque way. Very solid!
I enjoyed this thoroughly, well designed puzzles and well implemented.
Well done puzzles! I'm also terribly amused by the idea of a corporate team building exercise resulting in the death of some of the employees.
Great puzzles, very original take on the theme

name: Drive or Die
body:
![nicegame.png](ludum-dare/41/drive-or-die/images/1031a.png)

Drive fast and rob banks.

## Keys
| Key(s)            | Action        |
| ----------------- |:-------------:|
| Arrows / WASD     | Drive         | 
| Esc               | Pause         |
| Spacebar          | Brake         |
| Left Mouse button | Shoot         |

comments.body: Finished the first level with <1 second left! Definitely got pretty tense near the end. haha

A bit of feedback:
- The car drifts a bit too much, it feels more like a block of ice, haha
- Enemies give no indication of where they are coming from and spawn it at weird intervals, making the 1st person pretty annoying. They should come from around buildings (walking before shooting) or have sounds/particle effects when spawning to help guide the player to where they are
- The Minimap is great 👍
- The road should be raised just a hair above the grass to remove the black clipping lines where the objects overlap
I wanted to go a lot faster than I was. Wasn't really sure where to go either. It was fun though. Enjoyed it for a couple minutes.
So much drift. The concept was interesting and its too bad the driving part made it kind of not fun. Still it was kind of fun. Good work.
Good minimap!
Generally a really nice idea. Graphics were ok, but the steering felt a little too sensitive. Minimap really did it's job!
The concept is nice, though the enemy spawns were a bit annoying. Good job :)

As others have said, the driving model in this game really breaks it. Turning is way too slow and there is not enough friction. It's difficult enough to drive down a straight road; making a turn without veering off into the grass is basically impossible.

I got through the first two levels with barely enough time left on the clock, but the third seemed like I had to know the map well to actually beat it, since there's branching paths that aren't all visible on the minimap.

I really like the transition animation between the driving and the shooting.

Shooting didn't have much weight to it, I just had to locate and click on all the enemies. I wonder if a little bit of kickback on the player camera, or a more visceral death animation would help this section.

I think the driving music was a bit too aggressive and sine-y and grated on me a little after a few levels. The shooting music tones down the frustrating bits so I enjoyed that a lot more. Oh, and it's rare to see a LD game with multiple music tracks so nice work there, and with the transition.

Overall, this game feels like it just needed a lot more love put into its core mechanics (the driving and shooting models), maybe at the cost of the maps and objectives being less fleshed-out, or fewer levels. I know I've made the same mistake myself sometimes, prioritizing content without a good baseline mechanic. Maybe keep that in mind next LD.

name: Being Plundered
body:
![mini2.png](ludum-dare/40/being-plundered/images/a90f.png)

In *Being Plundered*, you are a hard-working asteroid miner who dreams of rich life. Yet every time you get closer to your dreams, those damn space pirates show up and force you to spend your money on repairs.

Reach your dream goal of $100000 by mining asteroids and selling the ore, but watch out for the pirates!
The more ore and money you have, the more pirates there will be!

**WEBGL BUILD**: https://bradur.github.io/LD40/

## Keys
### Everywhere
| Key(s)        | Action        |
| ------------- |:-------------:|
| Arrows / WASD | Movement      | 
| Esc / Z       | Pause         |
| Alt / B       | Toggle radar  |
| P             | Toggle music  |
| O             | Toggle sfx    |

### Only outside the space station
| Key(s)        | Action        |
| ------------- |:-------------:|
| Space / Q     | Shoot cannon  | 
| Ctrl /  E     | Fire laser    |

### Only in a shop
| Key(s)        | Action        |
| ------------- |:-------------:|
| Enter         | Buy / Sell    | 

## Tips
- Use the laser on an asteroid. The asteroid will blow up eventually, netting you some ore!
- When away from the space station, the green arrow points towards it
- A good way to kite the pirates is to go backwards and shoot
- Fire the laser AND the cannon at the same time when fighting pirates!
- Use the radar!
- Moving in the space station doesn't consume fuel
- Pirates cannot into space (station)

## Build info
- I have only tested the WebGL & Windows builds

## Tools
- Unity3D & Visual Studio Community
- LMMS for music & sfx
- Paint.NET

## Screenshots
![Warping in](ludum-dare/40/being-plundered/images/a81a.png)

![Pirates Galore](ludum-dare/40/being-plundered/images/a817.png)

![Mining](ludum-dare/40/being-plundered/images/a85d.png)

comments.body: oh, this is my favorite game on this jam! cool music, beautiful graphics, interesting gameplay. thank u, dev :rocket:
Well done on the music. This is one of my highest-rated by mood.
Love this. Very well made game in all aspects (gameplay, graphics, audio). Had to check if it is a Compo entry :)
Love the songs! I really enjoyed flying the ship, really my kind of game (look at my entry!) with physics-based control.

Whaow this game feels so complete. I mean gameplay itself is pretty good and entertaining but little things like music change on 'safe zone', how pirates warp in after you destroy asteroids and movement in generals feels so smooth. This game feels really polished, most impressing for 48 hours. Well done, well done.
Fun game - I got so close to winning but the pirates overwhelmed me. (97k and 1 asteroid very close to base) Liked the music and graphics quite a bit. Thanks for a fun game.
Really love your game! Its inovative and pretty fun

Hey, you weren't kidding about similar ideas! Yours is definitely WAAAY more polished than mine, however, but you've very much made a game right in line with what I was hoping for with mine. Feels complete, the refueling/repair station is great, and it's surprising relaxing (not something I had in mind for mine, heh).  

Super slick. Congrats!
Nice game. Like the buying options. Combat could use some more explosions and stuff. Also the music was very nice.
really good game, love the music!
Really like the music and was a lot of fun.

It has a good amount of content for something made in 48 hours. I just recommend changing the controls of the web version (not that you could change them anymore, though), for example pressing Ctrl and Space takes me to the starting page in Opera, and Alt opens a menu.
the best game  i played till now. the music and mood are perfect

This. Is. Amazing. I love it!

# Good stuff:

- It's got so many small details, like the warping-in animation that the pirates do, and the little maneuvering thrusters when turning.
- I love the music and sound effects.
- Graphics are great too - I really like the style.

# Bad stuff:

- I feel like there's way too much drag inside the space station. It's really hard to move in there.
- There doesn't seem to be any damage when you hit something, which makes 'crash into stuff to save fuel when slowing down' a valid tactic.

Wowww this is solid. I love the slowing down near the power ups like it's a space station. I like the bounce back on the purple gaseous boundary of space. I like the space ships, rather intimidating but as long as you don't freeze up like a deer in headlights you can take them rope-a-dope style strafe maneuver. I'm gonna keep playing! Excellent work. And nice touch allowing the player to toggle music that's thoughtful!

Thank you everyone who played my game! I love the feedback you've given :).

Hey @willbl3pic thanks for the constructive criticism.

- The drag inside the space station is a lot, I agree. I think I will spend some time thinking for a better solution if I continue development.

- Good point about the crashing! This wouldn't be hard to add. Maybe I will :).
Very complex game! I included it in my Ludum Dare 40 compilation video series, if you’d like to take a look. :) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CUur4iynK94

I had a lot of fun with this game. It reminds me of [Asteroid Scavenger](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/39/asteroid-scavenger) by @blueman which was one of my favourites from LD39. Others have praised most of the things I like about Being Plundered so I won't repeat their words.

I found that the best strategy is to rush out, mine an asteroid, and rush back to the station without ever interacting with the pirates at all. You can easily move faster than the pirates or their bullets so it's easiest to just never fight them :) plus you save money on repairing your ship. Early in the game I found it fun to fight the pirates (I've never seen this type of combat in a game before but I really like it) but in my pursuit of $100k it was just better to avoid them.

I don't like that weird shaky effect on the background while mining, it's disorienting. I also wish that you could keep playing after reaching $100k. I was looking forward to mining every single asteroid in the whole map.

Solid game, I'm really glad I played it :)
This would go very nicely with a perhaps more advanced ship building feature (kinda like nimbatus I am imagining here)

Nice game that fits the theme quite well. For expansion, I would have liked to seethe opportunity to upgrade my ship. After all, I am mining asteroids just to fix and fuel my ship. I'd like to be able to get a better one. Great job with the limitations, though!

Yeeahh, made it to 100k (barely). Blocking space pirates with asteroids was a surprisingly optimal strategy. 

I liked the drag effect at the space station, though I'll admit it's kinda disheartening if you get shot while entering it and can't do anything. Overall, the game felt like a very complete package to me. All thumbs up!

Thanks to @Iamsodarncool for the compliment and bringing me to this game! With a hard theme imo, it was hard to be creative, but you followed the theme well with an original idea nonetheless. The combat felt a little stiff, but the rest of the game was smooth to play. It looks nice and the music is a good addition, well made!

I suck at this type of game, but enjoy it.
music fits well and melancholic mood is great.
Not really original but well executed!
Never was good at asteroid game but this one was enjoyable for me. One thing I learnt: Never mine large asteroids. The music is a bliss to hear. Good Work.

Neat game. I think this is my favorite compo game so far. The turning is a bit fast which makes movement challenging and it gets pretty hard once a ton of ships start warping in. I thought it was based on amount you were hauling but I mined a small asteroid and 5+ ships still warped in. I guess its based on the largest asteroid you mined so you should probably go in size order?

@rasm Hey thanks for playing! The amount of pirates is based on the amount of money you have & the amount of ore you have & the amount of ore you are getting from the asteroid. So if you have 10k money and 5 ore and you mine an asteroid worth of 5, you get (10 + 5 + 5 / 10) = 2 pirates.

Very nice game! At first I felt that there is quite a lot of things to learn but as soon as I learned the basics I really enjoyed the game. I even managed to reach 100000$. :slight_smile: Maybe the AI of the pirates could have been more sophisticated (for example anticipating the direction I am flying) and controlling the spaceship was a bit sluggish. However, the overall design and implementation is very good! :slight_smile:
Hey, cool game here, mining asteroids with lazers is always great. The pirates arrival animation is a nice touch. It was fun to play it. Only wish speed around station was a bit faster.

I loved the art and the music. The controls are tricky, but I like the idea a lot. We played your game on our Twitch stream. There will be a video of it posted on our Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCW4XMpP2tKwBCS5NEgPGbhA?

Really solid effort. Everything works and feels solid in its execution. I am an asteroids hater, but this kept me playing way longer than most would. Pleasant experience all round. If you are still in the market for playing games I still need some ratings to get my 20. Run Guys could do with a little help! Thanks

I really enjoy the mix of relaxing grunt-work and action-packed gunfights. Dynamic music could really take this somewhere.

What I'm having most problems with is what to do when those pesky pirates follow me back to base. 

![how-to-get-out 2017-12-16 kl. 12.41.26.png](ludum-dare/40/being-plundered/images/e9e0.png)

Cant really find a good way to break out of this situation since I cant fire the guns from inside the shield.

Speaking of the home base, using different docking stations for different purposes (sell ore, refill fuel, repair ship) is a really nice touch.
This game has so much polish and features for a compo entry it's sick. Great mechanics and stuff.

name: In Charge of Power
body:
**A new city has been built! But who turned off the lights?**

![2017-07-31 02_56_16-Greenshot (Custom) (2).png](ludum-dare/39/in-charge-of-power/images/5e1a.png)

*In Charge of Power* is a game in which you are responsible for providing electricity for a recently founded city. As the city gains more citizens, the need for electricity grows steadily. Will you be able to provide for the city, or will you run out of power and become a disappointment? See if you can help the city grow to a population of **one hundred citizens**!

![2017-07-31 02_56_57-Greenshot (Custom) (2).png](ludum-dare/39/in-charge-of-power/images/5e1b.png)

*How to play*
1. Use your mouse to hover over things and perhaps click some of those things.
2. The game should be able to tell you which things are worth clicking.
3. For adventurous folks the game also reacts to scrolling of the wheel and panning of the screen.

![2017-07-31 02_57_28-Greenshot (Custom) (2).png](ludum-dare/39/in-charge-of-power/images/5e26.png)

*I have only tested the Windows build with these resolutions: 1280x720, 1920x1080, 2560x1440.*

![2017-07-31 02_57_04-Greenshot (Custom) (2).png](ludum-dare/39/in-charge-of-power/images/5e24.png)

comments.body:
I think the game could do with a bit of balancing because I found it hard to get over about 20 citizens, but the game is good otherwise. 
It might be worth adding some more ways to get money, or increasing the amount of coal a processing plant produces so it can provide for 2 coal plants.
The music is well made, the concept is interesting, and it's fun to replay.

I've always been a fan of Sim City like games so you get bonus points from me! Love the music as well, and gave the game multiple attempts. It seems to get really hard when you have 20 or so citizens.
Nice game.

name: Out of This Small World
body:
![flippers.png](ludum-dare/38/out-of-this-small-world/images/8f1.png)

**Out of This Small World** is a puzzle game, where you're on a small planet.
You must use the curvature of the planet to your advantage! (hint: the map loops on itself).
Step through the portal and get Out of This Small World (just to find another one behind the portal).

## Download:
* **Windows:** https://github.com/bradur/LD38/releases/download/1.0/OutofThisSmallWorld_win.zip
* **Max OSX:** https://github.com/bradur/LD38/releases/download/1.0/OutofThisSmallWorld_mac.zip
* **Linux:** https://github.com/bradur/LD38/releases/download/1.0/OutofThisSmallWorld_linux.zip

*Only the Windows version has been tested*

*Meant to be run at a 16:9 resolution*

## Keys:

- Arrow Keys: Move
- Esc: Open menu
- (hold) Right Shift: Sprint while moving forward
- Space: Chop tree (when equipped with an axe and targeting a tree)
- Right Ctrl: Unlock a door (when equipped with a key and targeting a door)
- F1: Toggle info
- P: Mute audio

## Tips:

- Some switches only work once, some work endlessly
- Axes are poorly made. They can only withstand chopping down one tree before they break!
- If you have flippers you can walk on water (no time to implement swimming animation!).

## Bugs:

- The looping world was implemented very poorly. Bugs related to that are bound to happen.
- Sometimes a tree just won't go down. Restarting the level should do the trick! (Esc and Q).

## More screenshots
![yellowkey.png](ludum-dare/38/out-of-this-small-world/images/8ed.png)
![screen_1492988936.05.png](ludum-dare/38/out-of-this-small-world/images/8ea.png)

## Links
* **TWITTER:** https://twitter.com/bradurdung
* **SOURCE CODE:** https://github.com/bradur/LD38

comments.body:
Fun game. The idea is nice, but the constant rotation is highly irritating. Maybe I'm getting old :)

I had the bug, where a tree wouldn't vanish after being chopped.

I like this. I didn't have a problem with the rotation but I can understand that some might. I didn't like the fact that after teleporting I lost all my inventory - it seems a little unfair that I had to find flippers again!? Perhaps it's like The Terminator and only living flesh can teleport? :grinning:

I like the music - it fits the game well. Nice work.
